channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Russia to Hold Drills on Tactical Nuclear Weapons in New Tensions With West
item.description: Russian officials claimed the order was in response to comments from the West about the possibility of more direct Western involvement in the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Russia to Hold Drills on Tactical Nuclear Weapons in New Tensions With West
item.description: Russian officials claimed the order was in response to comments from the West about the possibility of more direct Western involvement in the war in Ukraine.

item.title: China President Xi's European charm offensive turns to trade and 'fair competition' as he meets with France's Macron
item.description: As France prepares to host the Summer Olympics, Macron said he would ask Xi to use his influence to make the Games “a diplomatic moment of peace.”

item.title: UChicago Says Free Speech Is Sacred. Some Students See Hypocrisy.
item.description: The president has allowed protest encampments. But they have also disrupted campus life, and he wants the tents down.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli Military Warns Thousands in Rafah to Evacuate
item.description: Israel wants to “move people out of harm’s way,” a military official said, a sign that it may be inching closer to invading the Gazan city in defiance of international pressure.

item.title: Democrats race to design ways to best use AI in 2024 campaign
item.description: The technology that could transform American elections — and perhaps threaten democracy itself.

item.title: First Patient Begins Sickle Cell Gene Therapy That F.D.A. Approved
item.description: A 12-year-old boy in the Washington, D.C., area faces months of procedures to remedy his disease. “I want to be cured,” he said.

item.title: What to Know About Xi Jinping’s Trip to Europe
item.description: The Chinese president this week will be visiting France, Serbia and Hungary. His trip comes at a time of tensions with many European countries over trade and accusations of Chinese espionage.

item.title: 'The Fall Guy' posts weak $28.5 million opening, providing Hollywood a lukewarm start to the summer movie season
item.description: The modest start for “The Fall Guy” hints at larger concerns for the film industry.

item.title: A Fresh Approach to a Crisis
item.description: A group of researchers posited another explanation for the youth mental health crisis: Too much discussion.

item.title: Meet Edmundo Gonzalez, the Candidate Challenging Maduro in Venezuela’s Elections
item.description: Edmundo González, a former diplomat, is unknown to many Venezuelans. But some experts say that could work in his favor as he runs against President Nicolás Maduro in national elections.

item.title: Former Trump campaign manager who used Cambridge Analytica to target Facebook ads in 2016 run has returned with his own AI platform
item.description: Brad Parscale, the digital campaign operative who helped engineer Trump’s 2016 presidential victory, vows that his new, AI-powered platform will dramatically overhaul not just polling, but campaigning.

item.title: Israel Warns Thousands to Evacuate Rafah, and Hollywood’s Summer Gets Off to a Rocky Start
item.description: Plus, Stormy Daniels is expected to testify.

item.title: Are Flight Offsets Worth It?
item.description: A lot of them don’t work and some might even be harmful. But there are things you can do if you really have to fly.

item.title: Starbucks ex-CEO Howard Schultz says chain needs a major fix after biggest sales miss in years: 'There must be contrition'
item.description: Shares plummeted after sales dropped this month for the first time since the early days of Covid in 2020.
